name: digdugz
text: This was the first achewood strip I ever saw.

name: scion
text: Weird place to start...but then again, just as good as any other! Why does this comment get lames or chubbies?

name: zapatos
text: because it is at the top

name: theguitarhero
text: If you think that's weird, my first one was the day the Achewood Machine broke.

name: tollschaft
text: The first one i saw was in the bath-house arc. I was SO CONFUSED

name: jamers
text: Todd's been sitting on this little nugget for some time.

name: rosie
text: Little free steaks. Gross.

name: bookofsand
text:
Alt text: "Todd's on this thing so often he should have theme music and bumpers."

This is stone true, talking label or no talking label. Todd deserves branding.

name: k_buttsworthe
text: A comment left by k_buttsworthe was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, sarmatron, NDCaesar, Taidje_Khan, cailetshadow)

name: spinynorman
text:
Notice that the framing of the bottle label mimics the framing of Achewood panels to an astounding degree...

Otherwise the director is wasting a lot of space with the shot of Todd.

name: tekende
text: The director has no concept of mis-en-scene.

name: anomalous3
text: I wonder if this is where cartilege head got his inverse wine bottle...

name: joestork
text: A comment left by joestork was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Rhadamanthus, jyri00555, Scorpio_nadir)

name: catachresis
text: The little old-school countdown "2" is such a nice touch

name: ringwoodcomics
text: A comment left by ringwoodcomics was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Norrec, TonyHighwind, snitchy, Spenham, slickshoes3234, farqussus, NDCaesar, Xerol, godfatherofsouls, trawser)

name: slab64
text: A comment left by slab64 was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by apocowarg, TonyHighwind, Lumus, Axhoola, ringwoodcomics, shortside40, Satyr, gnjdfsgk)

name: ringwoodcomics
text: Thanks! Such civility.

name: slab64
text: A comment left by slab64 was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Mangtastic, Lumus, cailetshadow)

name: zapatos
text: but there you are

name: soticoto
text:
The words of a stoned cat.
Not in his right mind.
Being a dick to strangers is justified if they ain't done nothing for you and ain't going to.

name: clembot
text: the todd and T conversation is great and reminds me of the episode where they're listening to a police scanner and happen to pick up beef and molly ordering at a drive thru

name: slanger
text: I didn't really think much of this strip until I realized it was the "worst" conversation. (would I be on that beer label?  Probably.)

name: eric
text:
I think I understand the source of the magical realism.

I think todd's entire presidential campaign was broadcast live from that bottle!

name: 6kindsofawesome
text: I want a poster of panel #3.  Oh my gosh, do I want a poster of panel #3.

name: mugi
text: Exactly.  Best expression of his.

name: hellabosque
text: hahaha.  good call, man...i want one too.

name: julia
text: OHHHH the "Perceived Goods."  Aristotle always sets my lady-parts on fire.

name: pohlhoud
text: I'd buy such a bottle.

name: skellingtonloc
text: Edison freaks me out even more than Cartilage Head for some reason. I think it's his mood swings.

name: earendil
text: is it just me or is this guy straight out of a tintin comic?

name: joestork
text:
Man you're right. Like the gangster from Tintin in America.

Gotta say, I've like this arc better now that I'm reading it through a second time. It's got some pretty wicked photoshop, too.

name: foetus_punch
text: Lonis F. Edison is both the creepiest character ever, including Zell and Cory. Of course, Lonis is also the source of hundreds of fantastic quotes. So I am forced to love his comics.

name: i_love_kate
text: I actually find Todd's argument compelling.

name: quantumcasaba
text:
Everything about this strip is awesome.
From the surprised door, to the absurdity of a beer bottle talkie, and then tying it together with Todd's little gem as the worst conversation being had currently..
This is fantastic.

name: dropkickpikachu
text: I really like the ideas and the writing in this whole arc, but something about Lonis F. Edison doesn't work with me at all. Something about the way he's drawn makes this whole thing seem all... wrong, somehow. Something keeps me from liking him, no matter how hard I try.

name: zapatos
text: these feelings are natural, after years of evolution your body still holds natural terror in the face of the Lord

name: dasilodavi
text: I wonder if he picked up Todd's interview for Vice President.  Man that was rough!

name: defactory
text: I had totally forgotten about this brilliant, brilliant punch-line.

name: comic_sans
text: it's the first time reading this strip in about a year for me, and it just struck me that lonis invented a parallel youtube but on a beer bottle

name: rockstarsatemy
text:
i was just thinking that this strip is in black and white, and then i realized that all of the strips are in black and white.

this one just does so in a particularly pointed way. like the cartilage head arc.

name: norrec
text:
The alt text alone merits a five! How does Onstad consistently make good strips?

And I would so buy that bottle. I don't care what the price would be, I want one.

name: singtralala
text: boy am i glad it just plays worst conversations in english, otherwise it'd be me on that last strip (cuz i'm mexican)

name: wartooth
text: since i started reading this storyline, courage the cowardly dog has been on cartoon network, surreal...?

name: ham_shoes
text: Todd's gesturing with his arms as if the answer should have been obvious.  The next thing he might have said would be ", schmendrick!"

name: shutup_shutup
text:
As terrible as Todd can be, I have a feeling he is at least equaled in his time on the bottle by Showbiz.

...Camel fuckers!

name: nice-on-water
text: I think Lonis is Onstad's most well crafted character from a completely visual perspective.  Minus the fuzzy outline and that's an awesome looking dude.  Very distinct from the other characters, obviously on purpose, but still.

name: duperando
text: Good lord. If I could give this a 10,000 I would. The world's worst conversations beer bottle is just wonderful

name: griffypoo
text: Considering so many of the worst conversations happen while imbibed, I'd think eventually someone drinking this would end up just watching themselves for the duration of the drink.
